name: Light Glaive of Dunamancy
entries: This lightweight glaive with a shaft of polished gray wood bears numerous runes carved along its length. The glaive has 10 charges and regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff turns into dust and is destroyed.

While holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 2 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: {@spell fortune's favor|egw} (2 charges), {@spell pulse wave|egw} (3 charges), or {@spell gravity sinkhole|egw} (4 charges).

entries.name: New Possibility
entries: If you are holding the staff and fail a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can turn your failed save into a successful one. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

wrapped.name: Reach
entries: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.

wrapped.name: Two-Handed (small)
entries: This weapon requires two hands to use if the creature wielding it is Small or smaller. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.

_attunement: (requires attunement by a wizard or warlock)
